column1: Why did the fish swim off of the waterfall? for the halibut.
column3: Halibut refers to both a type of fish and a pun on halibut as in half a bit.
column4: The halibut is commonly found in North Atlantic waters.
column5: She felt half a bit sad after receiving the disappointing news.

column1: What did the mama cow say to the baby cow? its pasture bedtime.
column3: Pasture refers to land where animals graze and serves as a pun on pass your.
column4: The cows were led into the green pasture for the day.
column5: As the meeting went on, he felt it was time to pass your decision to someone else.

column1: What do you call a blind german? a nat-zee.
column3: Nazi refers to the historical National Socialist German Workers Party and serves as a pun in context.
column4: The actions of the Nazi regime were deeply regrettable and had a significant impact on history.
column5: He was a true visionary, embodying the qualities needed to lead a movement, akin to a zealot or a fanatic.
